headline: The Lord's Love
description: A two-panel juxtaposition in journal form—one side an explosion of color with a cross at the center, the other a childlike sketch of God’s voice breaking through despair. It captures both the cosmic fire of divine presence and the intimate, tender reminder that love saves even when faith falters.
author: Aleksandr
whyItMatters: This piece stands at the intersection of raw journaling and sacred revelation. The juxtaposition of a radiant cross with a sketch of God’s protective words shows Aleksandr’s dual way of seeing—sacred fire and fragile human longing woven together. It anchors the experience of faith not in certainty, but in being continually drawn back by divine love.
